docs.text: Introduction In 2020, I set myself to a goal of reading 1 book a month, 12 a year. This page contains an overview of books that I have read and/or are planning to read. I started to appreciate books (e.g. Audio books) ever since. It helps me to activate my brain, reflect on past experiences and to develop new opportunities. The ratings below are my personal ones, based on how I experienced the book and how relevant it is to my day-to-day life. In Progress Book Author Infonomics: How to Monetize, Manage, and Measure Information as an Asset for Competitive) Douglas B. Tough Conversations. Whole Hearts. Goldratt Business Adventures: Twelve Classic Tales from the World of Wall Street John Brooks Long list Leadership Start with Why: How Great Leaders Inspire Everyone to Take Action No Rules Rules: Netflix and the Culture of Reinvention Mindset: The New Psychology of Success You Look Like a Thing and I Love You: How Artificial Intelligence Works and Why It's Making the World a Weirder Place The Dichotomy of Leadership: Balancing the Challenges of Extreme Ownership to Lead and Win The Insider's Guide to Culture Change: Creating a Workplace That Delivers, Grows, and Adapts Lifescale: How to Live a More Creative, Productive, and Happy Life Managing Humans: Biting and Humorous Tales of a Software Engineering Manager The Unicorn Project: A Novel About Developers, Digital Disruption, and Thriving in the Age of Data Talking to Strangers: What We Should Know About the People We Don't Know Thinking, Fast and Slow Never Split the Difference: Negotiating as if Your Life Depended on It Switch: How to Change Things When Change Is Hard Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead Product Management related books Value Proposition Design: How to Create Products and Services Customers Want (The Strategyzer series) Business Model Generation: A Handbook for Visionaries, Game Changers, and Challengers (The Strategyzer series) Strategize: Product Strategy and Product Roadmap Practices for the Digital Age AI related books Deep Learning Interviews: Hundreds of fully solved job interview questions from a wide range of key topics in AI. The Big Nine: How the Tech Titans and Their Thinking Machines Could Warp Humanity Rise of the Robots: Technology and the Threat of a Jobless Future The War on Normal People Experience Over Degrees: The Blueprint to Get You the Job Your Degree Doesn’t The Sentient Machine: The Coming Age of Artificial Intelligence The Fourth Age The Act of Creation The Second Machine Age: Work, Progress, and Prosperity in a Time of Brilliant Technologies The Singularity Is Near: When Humans Transcend Biology Life 3.0: Being Human in the Age of Artificial Intelligence Possible Minds: Twenty-Five Ways of Looking at AI A Human's Guide to Machine Intelligence: How Algorithms Are Shaping Our Lives and How We Can Stay in Control Interpretable Machine Learning Superintelligence: Paths, Dangers, Strategies Artificial Intelligence Revolution: How AI Will Change our Society, Economy, and Culture AI Superpowers: China, Silicon Valley, and the New World Order The AI Economy: Work, Wealth and Welfare in the Age of the Robot INTELLIGENT AUTOMATION: Learn how to harness Artificial Intelligence to boost business & make our world more human Applied Artificial Intelligence: A Handbook For Business Leaders The Future Is Faster Than You Think: How Converging Technologies Are Transforming Business, Industries, and Our Lives (Exponential Technology Series) Architecture/Tech related books Technology Strategy Patterns: Architecture as Strategy 1st Edition The Software Architect Elevator: Redefining the Architect's Role in the Digital Enterprise The Model Thinker: What You Need to Know to Make Data Work for You Thinking in Systems: A Primer Software Systems Architecture Just Enough Software Architecture: A Risk-Driven Approach Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship Fundamentals of Software Architecture: An Engineering Approach Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software Domain-Driven Design: Tackling Complexity in the Heart of Software Refactoring: Improving
